discussion.content:
a,
Every Cisco Unified Communications Manager can generate one CDR file and one CMR file every minute for up to 1 hour. You can configure the maximum disk space that is used for storage of CDR files in the CDR Repository through provisioning.

Correct answer is A
Every Cisco Unified Communications Manager can generate one CDR file and one CMR file every minute for up to 1 hour. You can configure the maximum disk space that is used for storage of CDR files in the CDR Repository through provisioning

yep, still true for higher versions:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/service/11_0_1/cdrdef/CUCM_BK_RFDE0054_00_cucm-cdr-administration-guide-1101/CUCM_BK_RFDE0054_00_release-1101_chapter_01.html

questions.question_text: How fast can Cisco Unified Communications Manager generate CDR and CMR files?

choices.A: One CDR file and one CMR file every minute for up to 1 hour
choices.D: Ten CDR files and ten CMR files every day for up to 1 week
choices.B: One CDR file and one CMR file every second for up to 1 minute
choices.C: Ten CDR files and ten CMR files every hour for up to 1 day

discussion.content:
The answer is D. Unified Serviceability > Tools > CDR Management
You are specifically looking for CDR / CMR Files Preservation Duration (Days). This is located in Unified Servicability > Tools > CDR Management.

Correct answer is A
CDR File Time Interval: Required Field This parameter specifies the time interval for collecting CDR data. For example, if this value is set to 1, each file will contain 1 minute of CDR data (CDRs and CMRs, if enabled). The CDR database will not receive the data in each file until the interval has expired, so consider how quickly you want access to the CDR data when you decide what interval to set in this parameter. For example, setting this parameter to 60 means that each file will contain 60 minutes worth of data, but that data will not be available until the 60-minute period has elapsed and the records are written to the CDR database.
 This is a required field.
 Default: 1
 Minimum: 1
 Maximum: 1440
 Unit: min
Devon is right; In Enterprise parameters you can adjust time of data collection but CDR Management allows you to setup its preservation.

questions.question_text:
An administrator must keep CDR data for a longer period of time and wants to modify the configured value of the CDR/CMR Files Presentation Duration (Days).
Which menu options does the engineer navigate?

choices.B: Unified Serviceability > Tools > Serviceability Reports Archive
choices.A: Unified CM Administration > System > Enterprise Parameters
choices.C: Unified CM Administration > Call Routing > Route Plan Report

questions.question_text: A Cisco IP phone is connected to a Cisco switch and is trying to obtain its network configuration. What is the first protocol that is used?

discussion.content:
First protocol is by default obtaining PoE via CDP
Unless you do not have PoE on the switch it will be DHCP as secondary option
Shouldn't this be DHCP? The phone will also register when CDP is disabled ...

questions.question_text:
An engineer must generate a report of Cisco Unified Communications Manager usage for capacity planning. Where can this information be obtained within
System Reports?
A manager is generating bill reports for a particular user. Which navigation sequence must be used for this task?

discussion.content:
B. User Reports > Bills > Department
I checked my CUCM and found: User Reports > Bills > Department

C:
If you are a user or manager, choose Bills > Individual.

Perform one of the following tasks:
a) If you are a user or manager, choose Bills > Individual.
b) If you are a CAR administrator, choose User Reports > Bills > Individual.
The Individual Bill window displays.
should it be bills> individual? C?
